Financial Stress Index Signal

Market-wide financial stress and systemic risk conditions.

As of 2025-11-29

Gemini Summary

The market is currently exhibiting heightened financial stress, shifting to a Bearish sentiment as of November 21, 2025. The St. Louis Fed Financial Stress Index (STLFSI4) surged to -0.1331 (Stress_z: 1.700081), a significant increase from -0.5071 (Neutral) observed just a week prior on November 14, 2025. This pronounced uptick in stress, which has seen the signal predominantly 'Bearish' or 'Neutral' for months, indicates rising caution. This typically suggests a challenging environment for equities and industrial metals, with potential for a flight to safety benefiting bonds and precious metals as investors de-risk.

Technical Summary: The sharp increase in the STLFSI4 and the confirmed 'Bearish' signal point to a deteriorating technical outlook for risk-on assets. This indicates rising market volatility and potential for downside pressure on equities and industrial metals, driven by increasing financial instability. Conversely, the technical picture for safe-haven assets like bonds and precious metals may improve due to increased demand.

References:

  • St. Louis Fed Financial Stress Index (STLFSI4) - Latest: 2025-11-21. [Particularly relevant to the recommendation]
  • Publicly available data that would enhance analysis: Broader market indices (e.g., S&P 500, NASDAQ), bond yields (e.g., 10-year Treasury), key commodity prices (e.g., Gold, Crude Oil, Copper), and volatility indices (e.g., VIX) would provide a comprehensive, multi-asset class view of market health and sentiment.
